018package org.opengis.filter;
019
020import java.util.Optional;
021import org.opengis.util.CodeList;
022import org.opengis.annotation.UML;
023import org.opengis.geoapi.internal.Vocabulary;
024
025import static org.opengis.annotation.Obligation.CONDITIONAL;
026import static org.opengis.annotation.Specification.ISO_19143;
027
028
029/**
030 * Nature of the temporal operation between two geometries.
031 * Values are based on the 13 temporal relationships identified by Allen (1993),
032 * with the addition of {@link #ANY_INTERACTS}.
033 *
034 * @author  Chris Dillard (SYS Technologies)
035 * @author  Martin Desruisseaux (Geomatys)
036 * @version 3.1
037 * @since   3.1
038 */
039@Vocabulary(capacity=14)
040@UML(identifier="TemporalOperatorName", specification=ISO_19143)
041public final class TemporalOperatorName extends CodeList<TemporalOperatorName> {
042    /**
043     * Serial number for compatibility with different versions.
044     */
045    private static final long serialVersionUID = 6958011101187882290L;
046
047    /**
048     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the first expression is after the second.
049     * In pseudo-code:
050     * <ul>
051     *   <li>When comparing two instants: {@code self > other}</li>
052     *   <li>When comparing a period with an instant: {@code self.begin > other}</li>
053     *   <li>When comparing two periods: {@code self.begin > other.end}</li>
054     * </ul>
055     */
056    @UML(identifier="After", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
057    public static final TemporalOperatorName AFTER = new TemporalOperatorName("AFTER");
058
059    /**
060     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the first expression is before the second.
061     * In pseudo-code:
062     * <ul>
063     *   <li>When comparing two instants: {@code self < other}</li>
064     *   <li>When comparing a period with an instant: {@code self.end < other}</li>
065     *   <li>When comparing two periods: {@code self.end < other.begin}</li>
066     * </ul>
067     */
068    @UML(identifier="Before", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
069    public static final TemporalOperatorName BEFORE = new TemporalOperatorName("BEFORE", AFTER);
070
071    /**
072     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the first expression begins at the second.
073     * In pseudo-code:
074     * <ul>
075     *   <li>When comparing two periods: {@code self.begin = other.begin} AND {@code self.end < other.end}</li>
076     * </ul>
077     */
078    @UML(identifier="Begins", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
079    public static final TemporalOperatorName BEGINS = new TemporalOperatorName("BEGINS");
080
081    /**
082     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the first expression begun by the second.
083     * In pseudo-code:
084     * <ul>
085     *   <li>When comparing a period with an instant: {@code self.begin = other}</li>
086     *   <li>When comparing two periods: {@code self.begin = other.begin} AND {@code self.end > other.end}</li>
087     * </ul>
088     */
089    @UML(identifier="BegunBy", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
090    public static final TemporalOperatorName BEGUN_BY = new TemporalOperatorName("BEGUN_BY", BEGINS);
091
092    /**
093     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the first expression is contained by the second.
094     * In pseudo-code:
095     * <ul>
096     *   <li>When comparing a period with an instant: {@code self.begin < other} AND {@code self.end > other}</li>
097     *   <li>When comparing two periods: {@code self.begin < other.begin} AND {@code self.end > other.end}</li>
098     * </ul>
099     */
100    @UML(identifier="TContains", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
101    public static final TemporalOperatorName CONTAINS = new TemporalOperatorName("CONTAINS");
102
103    /**
104     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the first expression is during the second.
105     * In pseudo-code:
106     * <ul>
107     *   <li>When comparing two periods: {@code self.begin > other.begin} AND {@code self.end < other.end}</li>
108     * </ul>
109     */
110    @UML(identifier="During", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
111    public static final TemporalOperatorName DURING = new TemporalOperatorName("DURING", CONTAINS);
112
113    /**
114     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the first expression is equal to the second.
115     * In pseudo-code:
116     * <ul>
117     *   <li>When comparing two instants: {@code self = other}</li>
118     *   <li>When comparing two periods: {@code self.begin = other.begin} AND {@code self.end = other.end}</li>
119     * </ul>
120     */
121    @UML(identifier="TEquals", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
122    public static final TemporalOperatorName EQUALS = new TemporalOperatorName("EQUALS");
123    static {
124        EQUALS.reversed = EQUALS;
125    }
126
127    /**
128     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the first expression overlaps the second.
129     * In pseudo-code:
130     * <ul>
131     *   <li>When comparing two periods: {@code self.begin < other.begin}
132     *       AND {@code self.end > other.begin}
133     *       AND {@code self.end < other.end}</li>
134     * </ul>
135     */
136    @UML(identifier="TOverlaps", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
137    public static final TemporalOperatorName OVERLAPS = new TemporalOperatorName("OVERLAPS");
138
139    /**
140     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the first expression meets the second.
141     * In pseudo-code:
142     * <ul>
143     *   <li>When comparing two periods: {@code self.end = other.begin}</li>
144     * </ul>
145     */
146    @UML(identifier="Meets", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
147    public static final TemporalOperatorName MEETS = new TemporalOperatorName("MEETS");
148
149    /**
150     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the first expression is overlapped by the second.
151     * In pseudo-code:
152     * <ul>
153     *   <li>When comparing two periods: {@code self.begin > other.begin}
154     *       AND {@code self.begin < other.end}
155     *       AND {@code self.end > other.end}</li>
156     * </ul>
157     */
158    @UML(identifier="OverlappedBy", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
159    public static final TemporalOperatorName OVERLAPPED_BY = new TemporalOperatorName("OVERLAPPED_BY", OVERLAPS);
160
161    /**
162     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the first expression is met by the second.
163     * In pseudo-code:
164     * <ul>
165     *   <li>When comparing two periods: {@code self.begin = other.end}</li>
166     * </ul>
167     */
168    @UML(identifier="MetBy", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
169    public static final TemporalOperatorName MET_BY = new TemporalOperatorName("MET_BY", MEETS);
170
171    /**
172     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the first expression ends at the second.
173     * In pseudo-code:
174     * <ul>
175     *   <li>When comparing two periods: {@code self.begin > other.begin} AND {@code self.end = other.end}</li>
176     * </ul>
177     */
178    /*
179     * This value is missing from UML and table 4 of ISO 19143:2010 but is present
180     * in the XML schema definition. We presume that it has been forgotten.
181     */
182    @UML(identifier="Ends", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
183    public static final TemporalOperatorName ENDS = new TemporalOperatorName("ENDS");
184
185    /**
186     * Operator evaluates to {@code true} if the first expression is ended by the second.
187     * In pseudo-code:
188     * <ul>
189     *   <li>When comparing a period with an instant: {@code self.end = other}</li>
190     *   <li>When comparing two periods: {@code self.begin < other.begin} AND {@code self.end = other.end}</li>
191     * </ul>
192     */
193    @UML(identifier="EndedBy", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
194    public static final TemporalOperatorName ENDED_BY = new TemporalOperatorName("ENDED_BY", ENDS);
195
196    /**
197     * Shortcut operator semantically equivalent to NOT (Before OR Meets OR MetBy OR After).
198     * This is applicable to periods only.
199     */
200    @UML(identifier="AnyInteracts", obligation=CONDITIONAL, specification=ISO_19143)
201    public static final TemporalOperatorName ANY_INTERACTS = new TemporalOperatorName("ANY_INTERACTS");
202    static {
203        ANY_INTERACTS.reversed = ANY_INTERACTS;
204    }
205
206    /**
207     * The temporal operator which produces the same results than this operator when the argument order is reversed.
208     * May be {@code null} if unknown.
209     */
210    private TemporalOperatorName reversed;
211
212    /**
213     * Constructs an element of the given name.
214     *
215     * @param name  the name of the new element. This name shall not be in use by another element of this type.
216     */
217    private TemporalOperatorName(final String name) {
218        super(name);
219    }
220
221    /**
222     * Constructs an element of the given name.
223     *
224     * @param name     the name of the new element. This name shall not be in use by another element of this type.
225     * @param reverse  the temporal operator which produces the same results when the argument order is reversed.
226     */
227    private TemporalOperatorName(final String name, final TemporalOperatorName reverse) {
228        super(name);
229        this.reversed = reverse;
230        reverse.reversed = this;
231    }
232
233    /**
234     * Returns the operator which produces the same results than this operator when the argument order is reversed.
235     * For example, the reverse of {@link #BEFORE} is {@link #AFTER} and the reverse of {@link #CONTAINS} is {@link #DURING}.
236     * The reverse of the reverse (if present) is always {@code this}.
237     *
238     * @return the operator when argument order is reversed.
239     */
240    public Optional<TemporalOperatorName> reversed() {
241        return Optional.ofNullable(reversed);
242    }
243
244    /**
245     * Returns the list of {@code TemporalOperatorName}s.
246     *
247     * @return the list of codes declared in the current JVM.
248     */
249    public static TemporalOperatorName[] values() {
250        return values(TemporalOperatorName.class);
251    }
252
253    /**
254     * Returns the list of codes of the same kind as this code list element.
255     * Invoking this method is equivalent to invoking {@link #values()}, except that
256     * this method can be invoked on an instance of the parent {@code CodeList} class.
257     *
258     * @return all code {@linkplain #values() values} for this code list.
259     */
260    @Override
261    public TemporalOperatorName[] family() {
262        return values();
263    }
264
265    /**
266     * Returns the temporal operator that matches the given string, or returns a new one if none match it.
267     * This methods returns the first instance (in declaration order) for which the {@linkplain #name() name}
268     * is {@linkplain String#equalsIgnoreCase(String) equals, ignoring case}, to the given name.
269     * If no existing instance is found, then a new one is created for the given name.
270     *
271     * @param  code  the name of the code to fetch or to create.
272     * @return a code matching the given name.
273     */
274    public static TemporalOperatorName valueOf(String code) {
275        return valueOf(TemporalOperatorName.class, code, TemporalOperatorName::new).get();
276    }
277}
